dialogues.text: Yeah, I bloody found it, mate. Someday, when I found out who you are, I’1ll return the favor. Cheers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: London walks into the raucous space; he’s wearing glasses hat, nothing major, just enough to keep him from being ea recognizable. He pushes his way to the bar, jostling a BI BRUISER and leans toward the BARTENDER, who’s shoulder we over:

dialogues.speaker: LONDON
dialogues.text: I’1l have a Guinness.

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: Don’t have Guinness.

dialogues.speaker: LONDON
dialogues.text: Then how about a bloody mojito? Not too leafy. The Bartender steps out of frame, and London takes in his surroundings, until the Bartender slams some kind of DRIN down in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: Mojitos are eight bucks. Ten for you.

dialogues.speaker: LONDON
dialogues.text: Make it twenty, for all I care. This bloke here with the rancid breath is paying for it, innat right? THE BIG BRUISER can hardly believe his ears:  76.

dialogues.speaker: BIG BRUISER
dialogues.text: I’m buyin’ a plot for your grave, asshole.

dialogues.speaker: LONDON
dialogues.text: And I thought the English had bad teeth. Tell you what, why don’t you give him thirty and we’1l call it a day.

dialogues.speaker: BIG BRUISER
dialogues.text: I am about to end your life.

dialogues.speaker: LONDON
dialogues.text: No you’re not. You’re weak. You’re weak as a baby. You’re so bloody weak I can bring you to your knees with my little finger- London reaches out, presses the Big Bruiser’s shoulder wi finger, and to the shock of everyone around the bar, the slowly sinks down to his knees. London looks around, smiles: LONDON (CONT’D) Next round is on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA BOOMS down the white deco exterior, as we hear an AGENT’S VOICE ON THE SOUNDTRACK: AGENT’S VOICE (V.0.) We lost Osborne somewhere on the East Side. Guy is a really tough follow. STOP ON A CAR sitting across the street from the hotel; AGENT FULLER, eating a ham sandwich, within:

dialogues.speaker: AGENT FULLER, (IN PHONE)
dialogues.text: Roger that. The others are still in the hotel- least we didn’t make any of ‘em leaving -- isn’t that right? PAN OVER to THADDEUS BRADLEY, sitting beside Fuller, look very put out:

dialogues.speaker: THADDEUS
dialogues.text: Not that I’ve noticed.  77.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT FULLER
dialogues.text: Keep your eyes peeled, in case one of ‘em tries something funny. The rest of us might miss it -- being such a big bunch of rubes and all.

dialogues.speaker: THADDEUS
dialogues.text: I’1l do my best- That is, if I can make anything out through the haze of onion wafting from that thing you’re shoving into your maw. Crack open a window, will you? Agent Fuller glares at Thaddeus, then reaches for the win release... as the window goes down we see, at the crosswa A HOMELESS MAN in a HOODIE trying to wipe the windshields irate driver’s windows, moving further and further away w each consecutive car, and we

dialogues.speaker: DOLLY IN ON THADDEUS
dialogues.text: As a smile of recognition spreads across his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan and Alma step out of an unmarked car. They take in area: the security cameras hidden in the street-lights, t guards perched at the top of the building; TITLE CARD REA Bureau of Engraving and Printing - City of Salinas

dialogues.speaker: ALMA VARGAS
dialogues.text: Damn. I could leave my wallet on the ground, catch a movie, and nobody would steal it. Not on this block. Dylan shoots Alma a look and heads for the doors; we hear the SOUNDTRACK:

dialogues.speaker: LT. THOMAS, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: -- You think these hocus pocus guys are going to try to rob this facility..?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan and Alma stand across from LT. THOMAS and OFFICER SIEGEL.  78.

dialogues.speaker: LT. THOMAS
dialogues.text: -- Next thing Siegfried and Roy are gonna knock over the US Mint.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: Hadn’t heard about that, but thanks for the tip.

dialogues.speaker: LT. THOMAS
dialogues.text: Let me give you a little history lesson. The BEP has been around since 1861, and in that time, in all our facilities, do you know how many successful robberies there’ve been? Zero. Not one.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER SIEGEL
dialogues.text: We’re not some we’re not some ragtag rent-a-cops. We are the BEP police force. No one’s getting in here.

dialogues.speaker: LT. THOMAS
dialogues.text: There have been attempts before, sure. But they’ve always been inside jobs, and they’ve always been caught.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: I didn’t say it wasn’t going to be an inside job -- in part. (then) We have indications that they have blueprints to this facility. They know the exact location of every nail and screw drilled into this place, and-

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER SIEGEL
dialogues.text: And it won’t make a difference.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: Show me why not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alma and Dylan are at the X-RAY MACHINES. They dump their money and change into bins, as Officer Siegel and Lt. Tho watch on.  79.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER SIEGEL
dialogues.text: No money enters the Money Factory, or leaves the Money Factory. Except the money we print. They step into the bustling space. HEAVY MACHINERY HUMS a around. A WORKER pushes a large pallet of glass-encased BILLS across the floor.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: How much cash just rolled by? Lt. Thomas shrugs, used to this:

dialogues.speaker: LT. THOMAS
dialogues.text: A lot. WORKERS swipe their cards to move from one area of the ga area to another. ARMED GUARDS watch the floor from a catw high above them. LT. THOMAS (CONT’D) These men are the best in the business. Everyone in this room has SSBI, SCI and SAP level security clearance. They could care less about money.

dialogues.speaker: ALMA VARGAS
dialogues.text: Except for the ones receiving anonymous payments from the man who had somehow gained possession of the blueprints to this facility.

dialogues.speaker: LT. THOMAS
dialogues.text: Want to tell me who they are?

dialogues.speaker: ALMA VARGAS
dialogues.text: Sure I want to. We just don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: LT. THOMAS
dialogues.text: Yeah. Be sure to let us know when you find out. They stop in front of a CAGED IN HOLDING AREA where the PALLET OF BILLS has been wheeled into; the gate shut behi it.  80. LT. THOMAS (CONT’D) The new printed money stays here. It’s collected by armored truck in the morning, and delivered to banks all over the Southland.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: And there’s how many dollars in here on a given night?

dialogues.speaker: LT. THOMAS
dialogues.text: Eight hundred and fifty million. Dylan and Alma share an awed look; and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BEP cops show Dylan and Alma the small space, surroun by MONITORS:

dialogues.speaker: ALMA VARGAS
dialogues.text: Let’s assume our boys are going to hit this place. Tonight. If you were them, knowing what you know about this facility, how would you get in?

dialogues.speaker: LT. THOMAS
dialogues.text: I wouldn’t. There are cameras in every corner of the building. Every employee uses a scan card to move from one section to another. Anyone goes where they don’t belong, the gates come down. We got our guy. We got our money.

dialogues.speaker: ALMA VARGAS
dialogues.text: Except for you.

dialogues.speaker: LT. THOMAS
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ALMA VARGAS
dialogues.text: You just opened three doors in a row to allow us in here; clearly you have a master pass that allows you access to the entire building.

dialogues.speaker: LT. THOMAS
dialogues.text: (countenance darkening) What are you saying?  sl.

dialogues.speaker: ALMA VARGAS
dialogues.text: Just that if someone wanted to rob this place... it would help if they knew you.

dialogues.speaker: LT. THOMAS
dialogues.text: Except for one thing, detective. Everyone would know it was me. (hard) I spend enough time behind bars during the day. I don’t have any desire to spend my nights the same way.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER SIEGEL
dialogues.text: Everyone here’s given the strictest background check. You’re free to run another, anytime.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: Time’s the one thing we don’t have.

dialogues.speaker: LT. THOMAS
dialogues.text: You got the jump on these guys. You know they’re gonna try and hit this place, and they don’t know you know it. You’re so worried, cordon us off, no one gets in, no one gets out. (smiles) Show never happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan and Alma sit side by side, silent. Then:

dialogues.speaker: ALMA VARGAS
dialogues.text: He’s right.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: Yeah. Cordon it off. Like the Green Zone in Baghdad. No robbery...

dialogues.speaker: ALMA VARGAS
dialogues.text: No arrest. (beat) Fuck that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE “HOMELESS MAN” is shuffling down a side-street; WE RA FOCUS to reveal that we are looking at him from  82. INSIDE THE UNMARKED CAR which AGENT FULLER driving, THADD beside him:

dialogues.speaker: THADDEUS
dialogues.text: Keep on him. It’s the boy, Alex Hero. No doubt about it. ZOOM IN TO THE “HOMELESS MAN”- and we see there is an EAR PIECE hidden under his hair. His lips are moving. BACK TO AGENT FULLER: who speaks to the CAR-PHONE:

dialogues.speaker: AGENT FULLER
dialogues.text: You guys have him on audio?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUOUS
dialogues.text: SEVERAL AGENTS occupy the van, driving on a parallel stre listening to high-sensitivity audio devices:

dialogues.speaker: FBI AGENT
dialogues.text: Yeah, we got him. He’s on right now.

dialogues.speaker: HOMELESS MAN, (ON AUDIO)
dialogues.text: -- Yo, I’ve been made. I’m sure of it. They’re on me. I'm aborting.

dialogues.speaker: ANSWERING VOICE, (ON AUDIO)
dialogues.text: No way. We're committed and we're on the clock. Lose them. Whatever it takes. INT. AGENT FULLER’S CAR - CONTINUOUS Through the window Agent Fuller sees “Homeless Man” make sudden turn into a ONE WAY ALLEY, hurrying in the other direction, and:

dialogues.speaker: AGENT FULLER
dialogues.text: Damn. He spins the wheel, and tears up the street in order to c up with the “Homeless Man” at the other end of the block; Thaddeus holds on tightly, as they round the corner and s The “Homeless Man” opening the door of a PARKED AUDI; he slips into the vehicle -- We can see his hands reach unde the dash, and the ENGINE HUMS TO LIFE.  83. AGENT FULLER (CONT’D) I don’t believe it. This little bastard is gonna make me chase his ass. This is gonna get- VOOM! “HOMELESS MAN” tears out of the parking spot and ro right past the Agent Fuller’s car, racing in the opposite direction; and AGENT FULLER makes a hard U-Turn, burning rubber, and giv chase; Thaddeus shouts:

dialogues.speaker: THADDEUS
dialogues.text: Let me out. I didn’t sign up for this.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT FULLER
dialogues.text: You want credit for breaking the case, you gotta be there when it gets broke! (grins) Maybe you’ll get a new TV show. AND THEY TEAR DOWN THE STREET AFTER THE AUDI, as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sweating “Homeless Man” shouts into his ear-piece:

dialogues.speaker: HOMELESS MAN
dialogues.text: They’re on my ass, yo. This is not what I do, do you hear me? This is not what I do.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUOUS
dialogues.text: The AGENT driving does his best to keep up on the paralle street, as they hear from their equipment:

dialogues.speaker: ANSWERING VOICE, (ON AUDIO)
dialogues.text: If they can see you, they can hear you. No more communication. You’re on your own.

dialogues.speaker: HOMELESS MAN, (ON AUDIO)
dialogues.text: Hey..! But the line’s gone dead; nothing but static, and:  84.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The “Homeless Man” drives the Audi toward the freeway, followed closely by Agent Fuller, who is clearly a more experienced and steady driver... There are a few breathtakingly dangerous lane changes bet them... then the Audi veers right toward the 101 FREEWAY, only He is heading toward the OFF-RAMP -- The “Homeless Man” jerks sharply on his wheel to avoid ONCOMING TRAFFIC and THE AUDI JUMPS THE MEDIAN, falls a short ways and smashes onto its roof on the pavement below, as TRAFFIC SCREECHES a stop all around him... ANGLE ON FULLER’S CAR: as Agent Fuller throws open the do and runs down the median toward the upturned AUDI, where THE HOMELESS MAN IS VISIBLE -- Upside down, blood pouring down his face, eyes blood-shot, trying to pull himself fr but he’s stuck, and:

dialogues.speaker: AGENT FULLER
dialogues.text: Don’t move, boy. Stay where you are, and I’ll have an ambulance here in a- BOOM! The rear gas-tank of the AUDI EXPLODES -- FIRE INSTANTANEOUSLY spreads across the car, enveloping the HOMELESS MAN, who reaches out, screaming, and WHOOM! AGENT FULLER ducks, covering his head as the AUDI is torn apart by the terrible explosion. When he looks up, all he can see is a burning wreck, the burning body silhouetted the midst of the RAGING INFERNO; and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAC Hernandez snaps at Agent Fuller, Dylan, Alma and Thad Bradley, as well as a handful of FBI agents:

dialogues.speaker: HERNANDEZ
dialogues.text: Let me get this straight. These guys are the Beatles, and you just toasted Ringo.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: Actually, he was more like George, if you ask-  85.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT FULLER
dialogues.text: Jesus, Dylan. It’s not funny. He might have been a prick, but he was just a kid. Just a goddamn kid...

dialogues.speaker: HERNANDEZ
dialogues.text: And you wasted him. You were supposed to be shadowing him, not engaging in high speed chases. When the world gets wind of this, we are good and screwed. (pauses) This was our last chance to nail these bastards, and you blew it.

dialogues.speaker: THADDEUS
dialogues.text: Not necessarily. Every head turns toward Thaddeus:

dialogues.speaker: HERNANDEZ
dialogues.text: You seriously think they’re gonna go on with their plans without him?

dialogues.speaker: THADDEUS
dialogues.text: Atlas still doesn’t know we know where he’s planning to strike. He is motivated by ego. He shuffles around in a T-shirt, but ego is what drives him. (then) Challenge him there, and you’1l have your show. You just better start running yours as well as he’s been running his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SEVERAL UNMARKED CARS screech to a halt in the parking lo the doors fly open, and Dylan, Alma Vargas, Agent Fuller Thaddeus Bradley step out, accompanied by a few more AGEN and head toward the arena entrance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MICHAEL ATLAS is giving directions to the electricians, w he turns to see Thaddeus and the officers striding toward him:  86.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL ATLAS
dialogues.text: This is a closed rehearsal. Unless you have a warrant, I’m going to have to ask you to get the hell out of here.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: He’s dead. Michael stops in his tracks. Says nothing, waiting: DYLAN (CONT’D) The kid. Alex Hero. Dead. Michael motions to the electricians, who leave the area. stands alone on the stage. DYLAN (CONT’D) He died trying to slip us, because of this stupid game you’ve been playing.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL ATLAS
dialogues.text: I’d like to see him. His body.

dialogues.speaker: ALMA VARGAS
dialogues.text: There’s not much left to see, Mr. Atlas. The remains are being examined by our forensic specialists. We’ll have results within the next few hours. But he was identified before the acci-

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL ATLAS
dialogues.text: By whom? (turns to Thaddeus) By this bitter old bastard, who can hardly see past the tip of his own nose?

dialogues.speaker: THADDEUS
dialogues.text: If I’m bitter, it’s about the farce you and your ilk have made of what was an honorable vocation.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL ATLAS
dialogues.text: Honorable? Magic is supposed to fun. You better get off your high horse- especially since it’s a Trojan one. You don’t know what honor is... (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL ATLAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You’re just hoping to hang around long enough to get material for some bullshit book or show, so you can say you were a part of this, make a few dollars off the backs of real magicians.

dialogues.speaker: THADDEUS
dialogues.text: There’s nothing you know that I didn’t teach you, boy.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL ATLAS
dialogues.text: That so? Then tell them, Thaddeus. Tell them what I’m going to do next, if you’re so damn wise. Thaddeus glares as Michael; but he has no answer, so: MICHAEL ATLAS (CONT’D) No revelations? Then let me tell you: I’m going to call my lawyers. Because I don’t think there’s anything wrong with Alex. I think you’re holding him, to prevent him from performing tonight; and I’m gonna put you through a legal hell the likes of which-

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: He’s dead, Atlas. You can put that in whatever bank you’re planning to knock over. But we came to offer you a deal. (pauses) Stop what you’re doing, and we'll stop our investigation. Slow it down, bit by bit, ‘till this whole thing is just a footnote in the history books. Gone and forgotten. Michael’s eyes narrow; then:

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL ATLAS
dialogues.text: The public has no idea about this yet, do they? Alex is a rock star, and you morons killed him. Gonna make Waco look like a public relations coup for you people. (hard smile) This isn’t a game, Agent Hobbes. This is a business. And in this business, the show always goes on.  88. Michael reaches into his jacket... and a couple of the AG instinctively reach for their guns. Michael’s hand comes holding a SHEAVE OF TICKETS. He hands them to Dylan and Alma. MICHAEL ATLAS (CONT’D) Third row, center aisle. Curtain at nine o’clock sharp. And this time -- feel free to hold hands. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: CAMERAS FLASHING
dialogues.text: REPORTERS surrounding MICHAEL ATLAS, LONDON OSBORNE and RODERIGO as they give a hastily assembled PRESS CONFERENC

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: -- In light of today’s tragedy, are you still going through with tonight’s performance?

dialogues.speaker: RODERIGO
dialogues.text: Of course. We’re dedicating it to the memory of Alex.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: How will it feel to go up there so soon after-

dialogues.speaker: LONDON
dialogues.text: Feel? He was just a boy, and the bloody Feds chased him to his death, how do you think it’s gonna feel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE AGENTS listen to a number of televisions that are on the b.g. while they prepare for their night’s mission:

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: Christ, look at this prick. Kid gets killed, and he calls a press conference.

dialogues.speaker: ALMA VARGAS
dialogues.text: That’s show business, right? SOME OF TV’S SHOW THE BURNING CAR ON THE FREEWAY as captu on VIDEO:  89.

dialogues.speaker: NEWSCASTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: -- This burning wreck on the 101 Freeway was the fiery tomb of Alex Hero, the youngest and perhaps brashest of the Four Horsemen... ON OTHER TV’S the PRESS CONFERENCE IS PLAYING:

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: Can we expect the kind of surprise finale we've seen at your previous shows?

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL ATLAS, (ON MONITOR)
dialogues.text: If I told you, it wouldn’t be a surprise. Agent Fuller punches the TV off, simmering with anger; sl a clip into his .45.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT FULLER
dialogues.text: These guys are so in love with surprises. Let’s give ‘em one. SAC HERNANDEZ steps up in front of the agents, commanding instant attention:

dialogues.speaker: HERNANDEZ
dialogues.text: One more time. We don’t want to prevent this robbery, we want to catch these bastards in the act...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IMAGES OF THE FBI AGENTS situating themselves around the premises -- in nearby stores -- in cars -- on rooftops, a SAC HERNANDEZ’S VOICE CONTINUES on the SOUNDTRACK:

dialogues.speaker: HERNANDEZ, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: -- Which means you are to remain invisible, and until the moment arrives, not to interfere...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLES of UNIFORMED SECURITY GUARDS at their posts around interior of the facility, separated by wire mesh and gate

dialogues.speaker: HERNANDEZ, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: -- There is the usual after hours security detail of ten armed guards inside the Money Factory...  90.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alma Vargas is in the small space with Lt. Thomas and Off Siegel; surrounded by monitors with black and while image

dialogues.speaker: HERNANDEZ, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: -- The only ones officially aware of our presence are Lt. Thomas and Officer Siegel of the BEP. We make the arrest, but the collar is theirs. All right...

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: NIGHT STREETLIGHTS come on all around the area, illuminat it as if were a set on a stage:

dialogues.speaker: HERNANDEZ, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: -- Let's get this party started.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan, Agent Fuller and Thaddeus Bradley sit low in a car parked behind the building, where they have a view of the closed gates of the LOADING DOCK. It’s awfully quiet. Dylan’s phone vibrates; he talks into his ear-piece:

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: Hobbes here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAC HERNANDEZ hisses into his phone:

dialogues.speaker: HERNANDEZ
dialogues.text: Just got the call the Horsemen are about to go onstage. You sure we’re in the right place?

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: We're in the right place.

dialogues.speaker: HERNANDEZ
dialogues.text: It goddamn well better be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan presses his phone off. Exchanges a less than confid look with Fuller.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: It’s the right place.  91.

dialogues.speaker: THADDEUS
dialogues.text: You’re sure of that, are you?

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: You can shut up, Merlin. The only reason you’re here is I don’t trust you out of my sight for more than- THEN BRIGHT HEADLIGHTS sweep past them, and they look aro to see:

dialogues.speaker: AN ARMORED TRUCK
dialogues.text: Turning the corner, passing through the open gateway, and rolling to a halt outside the rear loading dock GATE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alma’s phone buzzes; she raises it to her ear:

dialogues.speaker: ALMA VARGAS
dialogues.text: What’s up, G-Man?

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: Tell me there’s no pickup scheduled for tonight. Alma turns to Lt. Thomas.

dialogues.speaker: ALMA VARGAS
dialogues.text: Tell him there’s no pickup scheduled for tonight.

dialogues.speaker: LT. THOMAS
dialogues.text: No way. Not ‘till six a.m.

dialogues.speaker: ALMA VARGAS
dialogues.text: (into phone) Not until tomorrow morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan’s face widens into a grin:

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: Then it’s on. Agent Fuller whispers into his WALKIE:

dialogues.speaker: AGENT FULLER
dialogues.text: It’s on.  92.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LIGHTS FLASH ON, illuminating the stage in the middle of huge arena, where MICHAEL ATLAS is standing, flanked hy LONDON and RODERIGO. Michael raises his hands, quieting d the crowd:

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL ATLAS
dialogues.text: I remember my first wand, when I was a kid. I’d aim it at things and try to lift them off the ground. The piano. The dog. My mother. It never worked... LAUGHTER FROM THE AUDIENCE; and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LARGE CROWD is gathered outside, watching Michael on

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL ATLAS, (ON MONITORS)
dialogues.text: -- My father died when I was ten. At the wake, I saw everyone crying; so I stepped into the living room with my wand, and did my first show. Simple tricks. You know. Kid stuff- Abracadabra- But I looked at the faces around me, and they were smiling and laughing. That’s when I found my magic. My mother passed a year later, and when she was cremated I put that wand into the fire to keep her company in Heaven,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael takes a moment, then:

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL ATLAS
dialogues.text: Today, as you know, we suffered another loss. Alex Hero is gone. But we’re going to honor him the best way we know how... the way he would have wanted us to- Michael points his finger and FIREWORKS GO OFF -- HEAVY M STARTS POUNDING. The crowd rises to their feet, CHEERING; and  93.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FBI SNIPERS peer through the scopes of high-powered rifle Their angle is bad, but they can get a glimpse of the ARM TRUCK by the loading dock, as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan and Agent Fuller watch silently, waiting, then: TWO UNIFORMED MEN step outside of the armored truck. One them walks to the rear gate, takes out a SWIPE CARD, and it past the electronic lock, causing the gate to start opening... THEN A THIRD UNIFORMED MAN opens the doors from inside th back of the truck, revealing a CACHE OF HEAVY WEAPONS.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: Oh hell. Wot good. Not good at all. (to Thaddeus) You stay put. Do not leave the car. He quietly opens the car door and steps outside, followed Fuller, both of them drawing their weapons. DYLAN (CONT’D) Easy... easy does it. Then they see that a SECURITY GUARD from inside the Money Factory is approaching the opening gate; the THIRD UNIFOR MAN is picking up a SHOTGUN from the back of the truck, a suddenly- BOOM! Dylan winces as Agent Fuller’s gun goes off right n to his ear. DYLAN (CONT’D) Jeezus! Agent Fuller looks shocked; shaking his head in dismay- a the THREE UNIFORMED MEN turn in surprise, looking extreme confused, and:

dialogues.speaker: AGENT FULLER
dialogues.text: I didn’t mean it, man. I swear to christ I- But Dylan is already running forward, gun leveled, shouti  94.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: Get your hands in the air. Get them up in the air. THE UNIFORMED MEN look around, still in confusion; and: DYLAN (CONT’D) (into his ear-piece) Give them warning shots. Nothing fatal. A COUPLE OF SNIPER BULLETS hit the ground near the unifor men, who drop their weapons and throw their hands up -- T Dylan is on them, kicking their legs out from under them, shouting: DYLAN (CONT’D) Spread eagle. Arms wide. Do it. They do it. Dylan kneels down and pulls their caps off- looks at their faces- JUST THREE TOUGH LOOKING GUYS WE’VE NEVER SEEN BEFORE. Agent Fuller rushes over, breathing hard:

dialogues.speaker: AGENT FULLER
dialogues.text: Who the hell are they?

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: I have no goddamn idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: London Osborne stands in front of a row of VOLUNTEERS lik conductor, watching them each expertly juggle a HALF-DOZE EGGS in the air, as if they were expert jugglers... London turns and gives the audience a cheeky look; SNAPS FINGERS, and suddenly the volunteers are fumbling and surprised, the EGGS LANDING EVERYWHERE, splattering on th heads, on the floor, as the audience is convulsed with

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE THREE UNIFORMED MEN ARE sitting on the ground beside gathered forces of the FBI and BEP; hands cuffed behind t backs -- A YOUNG AGENT looks up from his lap-top:

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG AGENT
dialogues.text: These characters aren’t on any of the security clearance databases. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG AGENT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They aren’t registered armored guards, either. Not from any known company.

dialogues.speaker: HERNANDEZ
dialogues.text: (to the uniformed men) You want to tell me who you are?

dialogues.speaker: UNIFORMED MAN
dialogues.text: We have a nine o’clock pickup. We have to pick up our payload at nine. Dylan steps over, holding their SWIPE CARDS:

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: They had cards with access to every room in the facility. The Agents all look up at Lt. Thomas and Officer Siegel:

dialogues.speaker: LT. THOMAS
dialogues.text: I’m the only one with that kind of access. But I sure as shit didn’t give it to these jokers. (to the unformed men) Where did you get these cards?

dialogues.speaker: UNINORMED MAN
dialogues.text: We were following procedure. We didn’t do anything wrong... THEN A CELL PHONE BUZZES from the back pocket of UNIFORME Guy #1 DYLAN removes it, looks at the screen: a TEXT MESSAGE THA

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: “My cousin has a sweater like that? Is it wool?” (then) What the hell is that supposed to-

dialogues.speaker: THADDEUS
dialogues.text: It’s code. Everyone turns and looks at Thaddeus, who strides over: THADDEUS (CONT’D) Old magician’s code. Houdini’s favorite, for its utter banality. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THADDEUS (CONT’D) During his act, he would ask it of an accomplice, in order to let him know if he was set to go on with a trick. (then) “Cotton,” was the response given, when the answer was “yes.”

dialogues.speaker: UNINORMED MAN
dialogues.text: This is bullshit. We had a nine o’clock pickup. We were here on time. We were following procedure.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: We’re not gonna get anything from these guys like this. Give me two hours with them back at HQ and I’l1l-

dialogues.speaker: HERNANDEZ
dialogues.text: You will do nothing, Agent Hobbes. Dylan falls silent. SAC HERNANDEZ waves to his men: HERNANDEZ (CONT’D) Clear the area. Lt. Thomas, this is your collar. You are coming with me to interrogate these men. I have one or two little questions for you to answer, as well. (turns to ALMA) Detective Vargas, your work on this case has been exemplary- but after you file your report with the BEP, you better catch the first flight back to Vegas. Alma bites her lip. Keeps her feelings down. Hernandez glares at Dylan: HERNANDEZ (CONT’D) You are done for tonight, Hobbes. You and Agent Fuller, the both of you. Done. Dylan takes that in. Nods. Types into the cell phone he’s holding: C-O0-T-T-O-N- then puts the phone into Hernandez hand, and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CROWD CHEERS as RODERIGO stands underneath TWO BEAUTI GIRLS, spinning them overhead with his fingers;  97. only the girls are split into TWO as they spin, their leg and _torsos interchanging in the air above the magicians’ head...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan and Alma stand by Agent Fuller, who is still shaken

dialogues.speaker: AGENT FULLER
dialogues.text: Sorry I let you down. I don’t know... I saw the weapons, and I overreacted... I screwed up...

dialogues.speaker: ALMA VARGAS
dialogues.text: We all screwed up. Nothing to do about it now.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, there is. (pauses) We might not be able to arrest him, but as far Michael Atlas knows, things went off just the way he planned. We’re fifteen minutes from Downtown. I don’t know about you... Reaches into his jacket, comes out holding the TICKETS

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL GAVE HIM
dialogues.text: DYLAN (CONT’D) But I’m gonna be there to see his face when he realizes he’s wrong.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL ATLAS
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen, we’re glad to have been able to take your mind off your troubles with a few hours’ divertissement...

dialogues.speaker: THE HUGE ARENA
dialogues.text: THE AUDIENCE rises to its collective feet, giving a stand ovation in anticipation of the Horsemen’s newest finale: MICHAEL ATLAS (CONT’D) -- But I can’t leave this stage without acknowledging that we are living in hard times.  98.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THADDEUS BRADLEY making their way toward the front of are and ANGLE ON MICHAEL, spotting them; a smile spreads across h face: MICHAEL ATLAS (CONT’D) We know you’re all suffering. But this is the biggest audience we’ve had... there’s a lot of you out there. That means we have to come up with our biggest score yet. And money doesn’t grow on trees... (pauses) But it is printed in factories. Michael turns to RODERIGO, who pulls a lever, and a DOZEN HUGE SCREENS descend around Michael, seeming to hover in air -- RODERIGO takes out a HANDHELD VIDEO CAMERA, points at the screens, and THE SCREENS SUDDENLY FILL with an IMAGE OF THE MONEY FACT moving through it, as if filmed by RODERIGO’S CAMERA as h paces the stage. MICHAEL ATLAS (CONT’D) Some of these places- like this one- can hold nearly a billion dollars at any given time. Can you believe that? ANGLE ON DYLAN AND ALMA -- Looking at each other; how do these quys do this? MICHAEL ATLAS (CONT’D) And here it is, the room where all that money is held. And there it is, in that glass covered pallet. Newly printed. Almost One. Billion. Dollars. THE AUDIENCE falls into a hush, hardly breathing, at the image of the CAGED ROOM HOLDING THE MONEY on the SCREENS. MICHAEL ATLAS (CONT’D) The government prints it, just like that, whenever they want to. But I think, for once, someone else should decide where it goes, don’t you? THE CROWD ANSWERS WITH AN UPROARIOUS AFFIRMATIVE.  99. MICHAEL ATLAS (CONT’D) Alright, then. So, with a single snap of the fingers- Michael turns to the screens- SNAPS. Nothing happens. A beat. Michael turns and shoots a look at Roderigo- who shakes h head, with a look that says: “I don’t know what the hell going on.” MICHAEL ATLAS (CONT’D) This is a really hard one. SNAPS his finger again. Again nothing. Michael waits another moment. Then, recomposing himself, turns back to audience: MICHAEL ATLAS (CONT’D) Ladies and gentlemen, it looks like you’re not going to get the finale you were expecting tonight. THE BIGGEST BOO YOU’VE EVER HEARD IN YOUR LIFE. DURING THE CACOPHONY EYE-CONTACT passes between MICHAEL A DYLAN, MICHAEL AND ALMA, MICHAEL AND THADDEUS... various degrees of gloating in their eyes, a tinge of defeat in h then MICHAEL raises his hands, trying to quiet down the crowd: MICHAEL ATLAS (CONT’D) Is this really why you’re here? For the money? Are you becoming the very people you disdain? The people you come to see us humiliate? Aren’t there more important things in life- like Love. .?

dialogues.speaker: HAS TO SHOUT TO BE HEARD ABOVE THE CROWD
dialogues.text: MICHAEL ATLAS (CONT’D) -- Like happiness? Like friends? Didn’t Jesus himself say it was easier for a camel to pass through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to get into heaven?  100. AS MICHAEL SPEAKS THE LIGHTS subtly change from WHITE TO

dialogues.speaker: YELLOW... TO ORANGE... TO RED... A STRANGE ROARING SOUND
dialogues.text: beginning to fill the AUDITORIUM: MICHAEL ATLAS (CONT’D) -- The same Jesus who, when a good man called Lazarus died, reached forth and brought him back to life. They said Jesus was the son of God when he did it. If I can do the same thing... what does that make me?
